answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Paresthesias or abnormal sensations can be due to diabetes, thyroid disorders, Lyme's or lupus should also be ruled out. The symptoms in your case could be due to spinal nerve compression in the lumbo-sacral region. This can occur due to spondylosis, narrowing of root canal, bulging disc, reduced disc space, tumors etc. A MRI of the region can help you diagnose this. This does not look like a vascular pathology. Please consult a neurologist for this. It can also be due to a vascular problem like deep vein thrombosis or a clot in deep veins. Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral.Take care!

question: I have had this feeling for a couple days now but it has never happened before.  It's just my left heel...i don't understand why cause i get up move around and happens even when i don't wear socks.  it's as if i have put on icy hot cream, but it happens where ever i go.  It's never happened before only just a few days ago.  It doesn't make any sense to me.  does anyone have any ideas??
title: heat sensation on left heel
